name: Abacus
desc: A standard tool used to make calculations.

name: Acid (vial) (Legacy)
desc: As an action, you can splash the contents of this vial onto a creature within 5 feet of you or throw the vial up to 20 feet, shattering it on impact. In either case, make a ranged attack against a creature or object, treating the acid as an improvised weapon. On a hit, the target takes 2d6 acid damage.

name: Alchemist's Fire (flask)
desc: This sticky, adhesive fluid ignites when exposed to air. As an action, you can throw this flask up to 20 feet, shattering it on impact. Make a ranged attack against a creature or object, treating the alchemist's fire as an improvised weapon. On a hit, the target takes 1d4 fire damage at the start of each of its turns. A creature can end this damage by using its action to make a DC 10 Dexterity check to extinguish the flames.

name: Alchemist's Supplies (Legacy)
desc: These special tools include the items needed to pursue a craft or trade. Proficiency with a set of artisan's tools lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make using the tools in your craft. Each type of artisan's tools requires a separate proficiency.

name: Alexandrite
desc: A transparent dark green gemstone worth 500 gold pieces

name: Alms Box
desc: A small box for alms, typically found in a priest's pack.

name: Amber
desc: A transparent watery gold to rich gold gemstone worth 100 gold pieces.

name: Amethyst
desc: A transparent deep purple gemstone worth 100 gold pieces.

name: Amulet (Legacy)
desc: A holy symbol is a representation of a god or pantheon. A cleric or paladin can use a holy symbol as a spellcasting focus, as described in the ^^Spellcasting^^ section. To use the symbol in this way, the caster must hold it in hand, wear it visibly, or bear it on a shield.

name: Antimatter Rifle
desc: It’s up to you to decide whether a character has proficiency with a firearm. Characters in most D&D worlds wouldn’t have such proficiency. During their downtime, characters can use the training rules in the Player’s Handbook to acquire proficiency, assuming that they have enough ammunition to keep the weapons working while mastering their use. |table-start| |row-start| |header-start|Name|header-end| |header-start|Cost|header-end| |header-start|Damage|header-end| |header-start|Weight|header-end| |header-start|Properties|header-end| |row-end| |row-start| |data-start|Antimatter Rifle|data-end| |data-start|6d8 necrotic|data-end| |data-start|10 lbs|data-end| |data-start|Ammunition (Firearms), (Range 120/360), Reload, Two-Handed|data-end| |row-end| |table-end|

name: Antitoxin (Legacy)
desc: A creature that drinks this vial of liquid gains advantage on saving throws against poison for 1 hour. It confers no benefit to undead or constructs.

name: Aquamarine
desc: A transparent pale blue-green gemstone worth 500 gold pieces.

name: Arcane Focus (Legacy)
desc: An arcane focus is a special item designed to channel the power of arcane spells. A sorcerer, warlock, or wizard can use such an item as a spellcasting focus, as described in the Spellcasting section.

name: Arrows (Legacy)
desc: Arrows are used with a weapon that has the ammunition property to make a ranged attack. Each time you attack with the weapon, you expend one piece of ammunition. Drawing the ammunition from a quiver, case, or other container is part of the attack (you need a free hand to load a one-handed weapon). At the end of the battle, you can recover half your expended ammunition by taking a minute to search the battlefield.

name: Assassin's Blood (Ingested)
desc: A creature subjected to this poison must make a DC 10 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, it takes 6 (1d12) poison damage and is poisoned for 24 hours. On a successful save, the creature takes half damage and isn't poisoned. **Ingested**. A creature must swallow an entire dose of ingested poison to suffer its effects. The dose can be delivered in food or a liquid. You may decide that a partial dose has a reduced effect, such as allowing advantage on the saving throw or dealing only half damage on a failed save.

name: Azurite
desc: An opaque mottled deep blue gemstone worth 10 gold pieces

name: Backpack
desc: A backpack is a leather pack carried on the back, typically with straps to secure it. A backpack can hold 1 cubic foot/ 30 pounds of gear. You can also strap items, such as a bedroll or a coil of rope, to the outside of a backpack.

name: Bad News (Exandria)
desc: Firearms are a new and volatile technology, and as such bring their own unique set of weapon properties. Some properties are followed by a number, and this number signifies an element of that property (outlined below). These properties replace the optional ones presented in the Dungeon Master’s Guide. Firearms are ranged weapons. **Reload**. The weapon can be fired a number of times equal to its Reload score before you must spend 1 attack or 1 action to reload. You must have one free hand to reload a firearm. **Misfire**. Whenever you make an attack roll with a firearm, and the dice roll is equal to or lower than the weapon’s Misfire score, the weapon misfires. The attack misses, and the weapon cannot be used again until you spend an action to try and repair it. To repair your firearm, you must make a successful Tinker’s Tools check (DC equal to 8 + misfire score). If your check fails, the weapon is broken and must be mended out of combat at a quarter of the cost of the firearm. Creatures who use a firearm without being proficient increase the weapon’s misfire score by 1. **Explosive**. Upon a hit, everything within 5 ft of the target must make a Dexterity saving throw (DC equal to 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Dexterity modifier) or suffer 1d8 fire damage. If the weapon misses, the ammunition fails to detonate, or bounces away harmlessly before doing so. **Ammunition** All firearms require ammunition to make an attack, and due to their rare nature, ammunition may be near impossible to find or purchase. However, if materials are gathered, you can craft ammunition yourself using your Tinker’s Tools at half the cost. Each firearm uses its own unique ammunition and is generally sold or crafted in batches listed below next to the price. **THIS IS UNOFFICIAL MATERIAL** These game mechanics are usable in your campaign if your DM allows them but not refined by final game design and editing. They aren’t officially part of the Dungeons & Dragons game and aren’t permitted in D&D Adventurers League events unless otherwise stated. |table-start| |row-start| |header-start|Name|header-end| |header-start|Cost|header-end| |header-start|Damage|header-end| |header-start|Weight|header-end| |header-start|Properties|header-end| |row-end| |row-start| |data-start|Bad News (Exandria)|data-end| |data-start|--|data-end| |data-start|2d12 piercing|data-end| |data-start|25 lbs|data-end| |data-start|Two-Handed, Reload, Misfire|data-end| |row-end| |table-end|

desc: Firearm bullets are used with a weapon that has the reload property to make a ranged attack. Each time you attack with the weapon, you expend one piece of ammunition. Drawing the ammunition from a case, or other container is part of the attack (you need a free hand to load a one-handed weapon).

name: Bagpipes
desc: If you have proficiency with a given musical instrument, you can add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make to play music with the instrument. A bard can use bagpipes as a spellcasting focus.

name: Ball Bearings (bag of 1,000)
desc: As an action, you can spill these tiny metal balls from their pouch to cover a level, square area that is 10 feet on a side. A creature moving across the covered area must succeed on a DC 10 Dexterity saving throw or fall prone. A creature moving through the area at half speed doesn't need to make the save.

name: Banded Agate
desc: A translucent striped brown, blue, white, or red gemstone worth 10 gold pieces

name: Barrel
desc: A barrel can hold 40 gallons of liquid, or 4 cubic feet of solid material.

name: Basic Fising Equipment
desc: This kit includes a small box of hooks, a pole, a line, and a net.

name: Basket
desc: A basket can hold 2 cubic feet/40 pounds of gear.

name: Battleaxe
desc: Proficiency with a Battleaxe allows you to add your proficiency bonus to the attack roll for any attack you make with it. This weapon has the following mastery property. To use this property, you must have a feature that lets you use it. ^^Topple^^. If you hit a creature with this weapon, you can force the creature to make a Constitution saving throw (DC 8 plus the ability modifier used to make the attack roll and your Proficiency Bonus). On a failed save, the creature has the ^^Prone^^ condition. |table-start| |row-start| |header-start|Name|header-end| |header-start|Cost|header-end| |header-start|Damage|header-end| |header-start|Weight|header-end| |header-start|Properties|header-end| |row-end||row-start| |data-start|Battleaxe|data-end| |data-start|10 gp|data-end| |data-start|1d8 slashing|data-end| |data-start|4 lbs|data-end| |data-start|^^Versatile^^ (1d10), ^^Topple^^|data-end| |row-end| |table-end|

name: Bedroll
desc: You never know where you’re going to sleep, and a bedroll helps you get better sleep in a hayloft or on the cold ground. A bedroll consists of bedding and a blanket thin enough to be rolled up and tied. In an emergency, it can double as a stretcher.

name: Bell
desc: A standard bell that rings, typically used for signaling.

name: Bit and Bridle
desc: Standard equipment used to direct a mount.

name: Black Opal
desc: A translucent dark green with black mottling and golden flecks gemstone worth 1,000 gold pieces

name: Black Pearl
desc: An opaque pure black gemstone worth 500 gold pieces.

name: Black Sapphire
desc: A translucent lustrous black gemstone with glowing highlights worth 5,000 gold pieces.

name: Blanket
desc: A thick, quilted, blanket made to keep you warm in cold weather.

name: Blasting Powder
tags: from Explorer's Guide to Wildemount - Chapter 5

name: Block and Tackle
desc: A set of pulleys with a cable threaded through them and a hook to attach to objects, a block and tackle allows you to hoist up to four times the weight you can normally lift.

name: Block of Incense
desc: A block of incense, typically found in a ^^priest's pack^^.

name: Bloodstone
desc: An opaque dark gray gemstone with red flecks worth 50 gold pieces

name: Blowgun
desc: Proficiency with a Blowgun allows you to add your proficiency bonus to the attack roll for any attack you make with it. This weapon has the following mastery property. To use this property, you must have a feature that lets you use it. Vex. If you hit a creature with this weapon and deal damage to the creature, you have Advantage on your next attack roll against that creature before the end of your next turn. |table-start| |row-start| |header-start|Name|header-end| |header-start|Cost|header-end| |header-start|Damage|header-end| |header-start|Weight|header-end| |header-start|Properties|header-end| |row-end| |row-start| |data-start|Blowgun|data-end| |data-start|10 gp|data-end| |data-start|1 piercing|data-end| |data-start|1 lb|data-end| |data-start|Ammunition, Loading, (Range 25/100), Vex|data-end| |row-end| |table-end|

At the end of the battle, you can recover half your expended ammunition by taking a minute to search the battlefield.

desc: A transparent blue-white to medium blue gemstone worth 1,000 gold pieces.

desc: A transparent deep blue gemstone worth 500 gold pieces

name: Bomb
desc: As an action, a character can light this bomb and throw it at a point up to 60 feet away. Each creature within 5 feet of that point must succeed on a DC 12 Dexterity saving throw or take 3d6 ^^fire damage^^.

name: Book
desc: A book might contain poetry, historical accounts, information pertaining to a particular field of lore, diagrams and notes on gnomish contraptions, or just about anything else that can be represented using text or pictures. A book of spells is a spellbook.

name: Boomerang
desc: The boomerang is a ranged weapon, and any creature proficient with the javelin is also proficient with this weapon. On a miss, a boomerang returns to the thrower's hand. |table-start| |row-start| |header-start|Name|header-end| |header-start|Cost|header-end| |header-start|Damage|header-end| |header-start|Weight|header-end| |header-start|Properties|header-end| |row-end| |row-start| |data-start|Boomerang|data-end| |data-start|--|data-end| |data-start|1d4 bludgeoning|data-end| |data-start|--|data-end| |data-start|(Range 60/120)|data-end| |row-end| |table-end|

name: Boots
desc: A pair of boots - included as part of most sets of clothing.

name: Bottle, Glass
desc: A bottle can hold 1 1/2 pints of liquid.

name: Breastplate
desc: This armor consists of a fitted metal chest piece worn with supple leather. Although it leaves the legs and arms relatively unprotected, this armor provides good protection for the wearer's vital organs while leaving the wearer relatively unencumbered. |table-start| |row-start| |header-start|Name|header-end| |header-start|Cost|header-end| |header-start|Armor Class|header-end| |header-start|Strength|header-end| |header-start|Stealth|header-end| |header-start|Weight|header-end| |row-end| |row-start| |data-start|Breastplate|data-end| |data-start|400 gp|data-end| |data-start|14 + Dex modifier (max 2)|data-end| |data-start|--|data-end| |data-start|--|data-end| |row-end| |table-end|

name: Brewer's Supplies
desc: These special tools include the items needed to pursue a craft or trade. Proficiency with a set of artisan's tools lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make using the tools in your craft. Each type of artisan's tools requires a separate proficiency.

name: Bucket
desc: A bucket can hold 3 gallons of liquid, or 1/2 cubic foot of solid material.

name: Bullets, Modern
desc: The ammunition of a firearm is destroyed upon use. Renaissance and modern firearms use bullets.

name: Bullets, Renaissance
desc: The ammunition of a firearm is destroyed upon use. Renaissance and modern firearms use bullets.

name: Burglar's Pack
desc: Includes a backpack, a bag of 1,000 ball bearings, 10 feet of string, a bell, 5 candles, a crowbar, a hammer, 10 pitons, a hooded lantern, 2 flasks of oil, 5 days rations, a tinderbox, and a waterskin. The pack also has 50 feet of hempen rope strapped to the side of it.

name: Burnt Othur Fumes (Inhaled)
desc: A creature subjected to this poison must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or take 10 (3d6) poison damage, and must repeat the saving throw at the start of each of its turns. On each successive failed save, the character takes 3 (1d6) ^^poison damage^^. After three successful saves, the poison ends. Inhaled. These poisons are powders or gases that take effect when inhaled. Blowing the powder or releasing the gas subjects creatures in a 5-foot cube to its effect. The resulting cloud dissipates immediately afterward. Holding one's breath is ineffective against inhaled poisons, as they affect nasal membranes, tear ducts, and other parts of the body.

name: Calligrapher's Supplies
desc: These special tools include the items needed to pursue a craft or trade. Proficiency with a set of artisan's tools lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make using the tools in your craft. Each type of artisan's tools requires a separate proficiency.

name: Caltrops (bag of 20)
desc: As an action, you can spread a bag of caltrops to cover a square area that is 5 feet on a side. Any creature that enters the area must succeed on a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw or stop moving this turn and take 1 piercing damage. Taking this damage reduces the creature's walking speed by 10 feet until the creature regains at least 1 hit point. A creature moving through the area at half speed doesn't need to make the save.

name: Camel
desc: ^^Camel Statistics^^ A good mount can help you move more quickly through the wilderness, but its primary purpose is to carry the gear that would otherwise slow you down. An animal pulling a carriage, cart, chariot, sled, or wagon can move weight up to five times its base carrying capacity, including the weight of the vehicle. If multiple animals pull the same vehicle, they can add their carrying capacity together. **Speed:** 50 ft., **Carrying Capacity:** 480 lbs.

name: Candle
desc: For 1 hour, a candle sheds bright light in a 5-foot radius and dim light for an additional 5 feet.

name: Carnelian
desc: For 1 hour, a candle sheds bright light in a 5-foot radius and dim light for an additional 5 feet.

name: Carpenter's Tools
desc: These special tools include the items needed to pursue a craft or trade. Proficiency with a set of artisan's tools lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make using the tools in your craft. Each type of artisan's tools requires a separate proficiency.

name: Carriage
desc: If you have proficiency with a certain kind of vehicle (land or water), you can add your proficiency bonus to any check you make to control that kind of vehicle in difficult circumstances.

name: Cart
desc: If you have proficiency with a certain kind of vehicle (land or water), you can add your proficiency bonus to any check you make to control that kind of vehicle in difficult circumstances.

name: Cartographer's Tools
desc: These special tools include the items needed to pursue a craft or trade. Proficiency with a set of artisan's tools lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make using the tools in your craft. Each type of artisan's tools requires a separate proficiency.

name: Case, Crossbow Bolt
desc: This wooden case can hold up to twenty crossbow bolts.

name: Case, Map or Scroll
desc: This cylindrical leather case can hold up to ten rolled-up sheets of paper or five rolled-up sheets of parchment.

name: Censer
desc: A censer, typically found in a priest's pack.

name: Chain (10 feet)
desc: A chain has 10 hit points. It can be burst with a successful DC 20 Strength check.

name: Chain Mail
desc: Made of interlocking metal rings, chain mail includes a layer of quilted fabric worn underneath the mail to prevent chafing and to cushion the impact of blows. The suit includes gauntlets. |table-start| |row-start| |header-start|Name|header-end| |header-start|Cost|header-end| |header-start|Armor Class|header-end| |header-start|Strength|header-end| |header-start|Stealth|header-end| |header-start|Weight|header-end| |row-end| |row-start| |data-start|Chain Mail|data-end| |data-start|75 gp|data-end| |data-start|16|data-end| |data-start|13|data-end| |data-start|Disadvantage|data-end| |row-end| |table-end|

desc: An opaque white gemstone worth 50 gold pieces.

name: Chalk (1 piece)
desc: A piece of chalk used for writing and marking on various surfaces.

name: Chariot
desc: If you have proficiency with a certain kind of vehicle (land or water), you can add your proficiency bonus to any check you make to control that kind of vehicle in difficult circumstances.

name: Chest
desc: A chest can hold 12 cubic feet/ 300 pounds of gear.

name: Chrysoberyl
desc: A transparent yellow-green to pale green gemstone worth 100 gold pieces

name: Chrysoprase
desc: A translucent green gemstone worth 50 gold pieces

name: Citrine
desc: A transparent pale yellow-brown gemstone worth 50 gold pieces

name: Climber's Kit
desc: A climber's kit includes special pitons, boot tips, gloves, and a harness. You can use the climber's kit as an action to anchor yourself; when you do, you can't fall more than 25 feet from the point where you anchored yourself, and you can't climb more than 25 feet away from that point without undoing the anchor.

name: Clothes, Common
desc: This set of clothes could consist of a loose shirt and baggy breeches, or a loose shirt and skirt or overdress. Cloth wrappings are used for shoes.

name: Clothes, Costume
desc: This set of clothes is fashioned after a particular costume, typically meant for entertaining.

name: Clothes, Fine
desc: This set of clothes is designed specifically to be expensive and to show it, including fancy, tailored clothes in whatever fashion happens to be the current style in the courts of the nobles. Precious metals and gems could be worked into the clothing.

name: Clothes, Traveler's
desc: This set of clothes could consist of boots, a wool skirt or breeches, a sturdy belt, a shirt (perhaps with a vest or jacket), and an ample cloak with a hood.

name: Club
desc: Proficiency with a Club allows you to add your proficiency bonus to the attack roll for any attack you make with it. This weapon has the following mastery property. To use this property, you must have a feature that lets you use it. Slow. If you hit a creature with this weapon and deal damage to it, you can reduce its Speed by 10 feet until the start of your next turn. If the creature is hit more than once by weapons that have this property, the Speed reduction doesn’t exceed 10 feet. |table-start| |row-start| |header-start|Name|header-end| |header-start|Cost|header-end| |header-start|Damage|header-end| |header-start|Weight|header-end| |header-start|Properties|header-end| |row-end| |row-start| |data-start|Club|data-end| |data-start|1 sp|data-end| |data-start|1d4 bludgeoning|data-end| |data-start|2 lbs|data-end| |data-start|Light, Slow|data-end| |row-end| |table-end|

name: Component Pouch
desc: A component pouch is a small, watertight leather belt pouch that has compartments to hold all the material components and other special items you need to cast your spells, except for those components that have a specific cost (as indicated in a spell's description).

name: Cook's Utensils
desc: These special tools include the items needed to pursue a craft or trade. Proficiency with a set of artisan's tools lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make using the tools in your craft. Each type of artisan's tools requires a separate proficiency.

name: Coral
desc: An opaque crimson gemstone worth 100 gold pieces

name: Crawler Mucus (Contact)
desc: This poison must be harvested from a dead or ^^incapacitated^^ crawler. A creature subjected to this poison must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or be ^^poisoned^^ for 1 minute. The ^^poisoned^^ creature is ^^paralyzed^^. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. **Contact**. Contact poison can be smeared on an object and remains potent until it is touched or washed off. A creature that touches contact poison with exposed skin suffers its effects.

name: Crossbow Bolts
desc: Crossbow bolts are used with a weapon that has the ammunition property to make a ranged attack. Each time you attack with the weapon, you expend one piece of ammunition. Drawing the ammunition from a quiver, case, or other container is part of the attack (you need a free hand to load a one-handed weapon). At the end of the battle, you can recover half your expended ammunition by taking a minute to search the battlefield.

name: Crossbow, Hand
desc: Proficiency with a Hand Crossbow allows you to add your proficiency bonus to the attack roll for any attack you make with it. This weapon has the following mastery property. To use this property, you must have a feature that lets you use it. Vex. If you hit a creature with this weapon and deal damage to the creature, you have Advantage on your next attack roll against that creature before the end of your next turn. |table-start| |row-start| |header-start|Name|header-end| |header-start|Cost|header-end| |header-start|Damage|header-end| |header-start|Weight|header-end| |header-start|Properties|header-end| |row-end| |row-start| |data-start|Crossbow, Hand|data-end| |data-start|75 gp|data-end| |data-start|1d6 piercing|data-end| |data-start|3 lbs|data-end| |data-start|Ammunition (Range 30/120), Light, Loading, Vex|data-end| |row-end| |table-end|

name: Crossbow, Heavy
desc: Proficiency with a Heavy Crossbow allows you to add your proficiency bonus to the attack roll for any attack you make with it. This weapon has the following mastery property. To use this property, you must have a feature that lets you use it. Push. If you hit a creature with this weapon, you can push the creature up to 10 feet straight away from yourself if it is Large or smaller. |table-start| |row-start| |header-start|Name|header-end| |header-start|Cost|header-end| |header-start|Damage|header-end| |header-start|Weight|header-end| |header-start|Properties|header-end| |row-end| |row-start| |data-start|Crossbow, Heavy|data-end| |data-start|50 gp|data-end| |data-start|1d10 piercing|data-end| |data-start|18 lbs|data-end| |data-start|Ammunition, Heavy, Loading, (Range 100/400), Two-Handed, Push|data-end| |row-end| |table-end|

desc: Proficiency with a Light Crossbow allows you to add your proficiency bonus to the attack roll for any attack you make with it. This weapon has the following mastery property. To use this property, you must have a feature that lets you use it. Slow. If you hit a creature with this weapon and deal damage to it, you can reduce its Speed by 10 feet until the start of your next turn. If the creature is hit more than once by weapons that have this property, the Speed reduction doesn’t exceed 10 feet. |table-start| |row-start| |header-start|Name|header-end| |header-start|Cost|header-end| |header-start|Damage|header-end| |header-start|Weight|header-end| |header-start|Properties|header-end| |row-end| |row-start| |data-start|Crossbow, Light|data-end| |data-start|25 gp|data-end| |data-start|1d8 piercing|data-end| |data-start|5 lbs|data-end| |data-start|Ammunition, Loading, (Range 80/320), Two-Handed, Slow|data-end| |row-end| |table-end|

name: Crowbar
desc: Using a crowbar grants advantage to Strength checks where the crowbar's leverage can be applied.

name: Crystal
desc: An arcane focus is a special item designed to channel the power of arcane spells. A sorcerer, warlock, or wizard can use such an item as a spellcasting focus, as described in the ^^Spellcasting^^ section.

name: Dagger
desc: Proficiency with a Dagger allows you to add your proficiency bonus to the attack roll for any attack you make with it. This weapon has the following mastery property. To use this property, you must have a feature that lets you use it. Nick. When you make the extra attack of the Light property, you can make it as part of the Attack action instead of as a Bonus Action. You can make this extra attack only once per turn. |table-start| |row-start| |header-start|Name|header-end| |header-start|Cost|header-end| |header-start|Damage|header-end| |header-start|Weight|header-end| |header-start|Properties|header-end| |row-end| |row-start| |data-start|Dagger|data-end| |data-start|2 gp|data-end| |data-start|1d4 piercing|data-end| |data-start|1 lb|data-end| |data-start|Finesse, Light, Thrown (range 20/60), Nick|data-end| |row-end| |table-end|

name: Diamond
desc: A transparent blue-white, canary, pink, brown, or blue gemstone worth 5,000 gold pieces.

name: Dice Set
desc: If you are proficient with a gaming set, you can add your proficiency bonus to ability checks you make to play a game with that set.

name: Diplomat's Pack
desc: Includes a chest, 2 cases for maps and scrolls, a set of fine clothes, a bottle of ink, an ink pen, a lamp, 2 flasks of oil, 5 sheets of paper, a vial of perfume, sealing wax, and soap.

name: Disguise Kit
desc: This pouch of cosmetics, hair dye, and small props lets you create disguises that change your physical appearance. Proficiency with this kit lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make to create a visual disguise.

name: Donkey (or Mule)
desc: ^^Mule Statistics^^ A good mount can help you move more quickly through the wilderness, but its primary purpose is to carry the gear that would otherwise slow you down. An animal pulling a carriage, cart, chariot, sled, or wagon can move weight up to five times its base carrying capacity, including the weight of the vehicle. If multiple animals pull the same vehicle, they can add their carrying capacity together. **Speed** 40 ft., **Carrying Capacity** 420 lbs.

name: Double-Bladed Scimitar
desc: The double-bladed scimitar is the signature weapon of Valenar elves. A haft of fine wood supports a long, curving blade on either end. Forged with techniques honed over centuries, these blades are strong, sharp, and remarkably light. Each scimitar is a masterpiece, and as a result the double-bladed scimitar is an expensive weapon (100 gp) — few though ever have the opportunity to purchase one. A Valenar blade in the hands of a non-elf is generally assumed to have been stolen or looted from a fallen foe, and a Valenar elf might feel entitled to demand its return or challenge the bearer to prove they’re worthy to wield it. Special. If you attack with a double-bladed scimitar as part of the Attack action on your turn, you can use a bonus action immediately after to make a melee attack with it. This attack deals 1d4 slashing damage on a hit, instead of 2d4. |table-start| |row-start| |header-start|Name|header-end| |header-start|Cost|header-end| |header-start|Damage|header-end| |header-start|Weight|header-end| |header-start|Properties|header-end| |row-end| |row-start| |data-start|Double-Bladed Scimitar|data-end| |data-start|100 gp|data-end| |data-start|2d4 slashing|data-end| |data-start|6 lbs|data-end| |data-start|Special, Two-Handed|data-end| |row-end| |table-end|

name: Draft Horse
desc: ^^Draft Horse Statistics^^ A good mount can help you move more quickly through the wilderness, but its primary purpose is to carry the gear that would otherwise slow you down. An animal pulling a carriage, cart, chariot, sled, or wagon can move weight up to five times its base carrying capacity, including the weight of the vehicle. If multiple animals pull the same vehicle, they can add their carrying capacity together. **Speed** 40 ft., **Carrying Capacity** 540 lbs.

name: Dragonchess Set
desc: If you are proficient with a gaming set, you can add your proficiency bonus to ability checks you make to play a game with that set.

name: Drow Poison (Injury)
desc: This poison is typically made only by the drow, and only in a place far removed from sunlight. A creature subjected to this poison must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or be ^^poisoned^^ for 1 hour. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the creature is also ^^unconscious^^ while ^^poisoned^^ in this way. The creature wakes up if it takes damage or if another creature takes an action to shake it awake. Injury. Injury poison can be applied to weapons, ammunition, trap components, and other objects that deal piercing or slashing damage and remains potent until delivered through a wound or washed off. A creature that takes piercing or slashing damage from an object coated with the poison is exposed to its effects.

name: Druidic Focus
desc: A druid can use a Sprig of Mistletoe (or holly) as a spellcasting focus, as described in the ^^Spellcasting^^ section.

name: Drum
desc: If you have proficiency with a given musical instrument, you can add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make to play music with the instrument. A bard can use a musical instrument as a spellcasting focus.

name: Dulcimer
desc: If you have proficiency with a given musical instrument, you can add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make to play music with the instrument. A bard can use a musical instrument as a spellcasting focus.

name: Dungeoneer's Pack
desc: Includes a backpack, a crowbar, a hammer, 10 pitons, 10 torches, a tinderbox, 10 days of rations, and a waterskin. The pack also has 50 feet of hempen rope strapped to the side of it.

name: Dynamite (Stick)
desc: As an action, a creature can light a stick of dynamite and throw it at a point up to 60 feet away. Each creature within 5 feet of that point must make a DC 12 Dexterity saving throw, taking 3d6 bludgeoning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A character can bind sticks of dynamite together so they explode at the same time. Each additional stick increases the damage by 1d6 (to a maximum of 10d6) and the burst radius by 5 feet (to a maximum of 20 feet). Dynamite can be rigged with a longer fuse to explode after a set amount of time, usually 1 to 6 rounds. Roll initiative for the dynamite. After the set number of rounds goes by, the dynamite explodes on that initiative.

name: Elephant
desc: ^^Elephant Statistics^^ A good mount can help you move more quickly through the wilderness, but its primary purpose is to carry the gear that would otherwise slow you down. An animal pulling a carriage, cart, chariot, sled, or wagon can move weight up to five times its base carrying capacity, including the weight of the vehicle. If multiple animals pull the same vehicle, they can add their carrying capacity together. **Speed** 40 ft., **Carrying Capacity** 1,320 lbs.

name: Emblem
desc: A holy symbol is a representation of a god or pantheon. A cleric or paladin can use a holy symbol as a spellcasting focus, as described in the Spellcasting section. To use the symbol in this way, the caster must hold it in hand, wear it visibly, or bear it on a shield.

name: Emerald
desc: A transparent deep bright green gemstone worth 1,000 gold pieces

name: Energy Cell
desc: The ammunition of a firearm is destroyed upon use. Futuristic firearms are powered by a special type of ammunition called energy cells. An energy cell contains enough power for all the shots its firearm can make.

name: Entertainer's Pack
desc: Includes a backpack, a bedroll, 2 costumes, 5 candles, 5 days of rations, a waterskin, and a disguise kit.
tags: Container, Deception, Exploration, Outerwear, Social, Utility

name: Essence of Ether (Inhaled)
desc: A creature subjected to this poison must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or become ^^poisoned^^ for 8 hours. The ^^poisoned^^ creature is ^^unconscious^^. The creature wakes up if it takes damage or if another creature takes an action to shake it awake. Inhaled. These poisons are powders or gases that take effect when inhaled. Blowing the powder or releasing the gas subjects creatures in a 5-foot cube to its effect. The resulting cloud dissipates immediately afterward. Holding one's breath is ineffective against inhaled poisons, as they affect nasal membranes, tear ducts, and other parts of the body.

name: Explorer's Pack
desc: Includes a backpack, a bedroll, a mess kit, a tinderbox, 10 torches, 10 days of rations, and a waterskin. The pack also has 50 feet of hempen rope strapped to the side of it.

name: Explosive Seed
tags: from Explorer's Guide to Wildemount - Chapter 5

name: Eye Agate
desc: A translucent gemstone with circles of gray, white, brown, blue, or green worth 10 gold pieces

name: Feed (per day)
desc: Standard feed typically consumed by a mount per day.

name: Fire Opal
desc: A translucent fiery red Gemstone worth 1,000 gold pieces.

name: Fishing Tackle
desc: This kit includes a wooden rod, silken line, corkwood bobbers, steel hooks, lead sinkers, velvet lures, and narrow netting.

name: Flail
desc: Proficiency with a Flail allows you to add your proficiency bonus to the attack roll for any attack you make with it. This weapon has the following mastery property. To use this property, you must have a feature that lets you use it. Sap. If you hit a creature with this weapon, that creature has Disadvantage on its next attack roll before the start of your next turn. |table-start| |row-start| |header-start|Name|header-end| |header-start|Cost|header-end| |header-start|Damage|header-end| |header-start|Weight|header-end| |header-start|Properties|header-end| |row-end| |row-start| |data-start|Flail|data-end| |data-start|10 gp|data-end| |data-start|1d8 bludgeoning|data-end| |data-start|2 lbs|data-end| |data-start|Sap|data-end| |row-end| |table-end|

name: Flask or Tankard
desc: A flask or tankard can hold 1 pint of liquid.

name: Flute
desc: If you have proficiency with a given musical instrument, you can add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make to play music with the instrument. A bard can use a musical instrument as a spellcasting focus.

name: Forgery Kit
desc: This small box contains a variety of papers and parchments, pens and inks, seals and sealing wax, gold and silver leaf, and other supplies necessary to create convincing forgeries of physical documents. Proficiency with this kit lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make to create a physical forgery of a document.

name: Galley
desc: If you have proficiency with a certain kind of vehicle (land or water), you can add your proficiency bonus to any check you make to control that kind of vehicle in difficult circumstances. **Speed** 4 mph

name: Garnet
desc: A transparent red, brown-green, or violet gemstone worth 100 gold pieces

name: Glaive
desc: Proficiency with a Glaive allows you to add your proficiency bonus to the attack roll for any attack you make with it. This weapon has the following mastery property. To use this property, you must have a feature that lets you use it. Graze. If your attack roll with this weapon misses a creature, you can deal damage to that creature equal to the ability modifier you used to make the attack roll. This damage is the same type dealt by the weapon, and the damage can be increased only by increasing the ability modifier. |table-start| |row-start| |header-start|Name|header-end| |header-start|Cost|header-end| |header-start|Damage|header-end| |header-start|Weight|header-end| |header-start|Properties|header-end| |row-end| |row-start| |data-start|Glaive|data-end| |data-start|20 gp|data-end| |data-start|1d10 slashing|data-end| |data-start|6 lbs|data-end| |data-start|Heavy, Reach, Two-Handed, Graze|data-end| |row-end| |table-end|

name: Glassblower's Tools
desc: These special tools include the items needed to pursue a craft or trade. Proficiency with a set of artisan's tools lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make using the tools in your craft. Each type of artisan's tools requires a separate proficiency.

name: Grappling Hook
desc: When tied to the end of a rope, a grappling hook can secure the rope to a battlement, window ledge, tree limb, or other protrusion.

name: Greataxe
desc: Proficiency with a Greataxe allows you to add your proficiency bonus to the attack roll for any attack you make with it. This weapon has the following mastery property. To use this property, you must have a feature that lets you use it. Cleave. If you hit a creature with a melee attack roll using this weapon, you can make a melee attack roll with the weapon against a second creature within 5 feet of the first that is also within your reach. On a hit, the second creature takes the weapon’s damage, but don’t add your ability modifier to that damage unless that modifier is negative. You can make this extra attack only once per turn. |table-start| |row-start| |header-start|Name|header-end| |header-start|Cost|header-end| |header-start|Damage|header-end| |header-start|Weight|header-end| |header-start|Properties|header-end| |row-end| |row-start| |data-start|Greataxe|data-end| |data-start|30 gp|data-end| |data-start|1d12 slashing|data-end| |data-start|7 lbs|data-end| |data-start|Heavy, Two-Handed, Cleave|data-end| |row-end| |table-end|

name: Grenade Launcher
desc: As an action, a character can throw a grenade at a point up to 60 feet away. With a grenade launcher, the character can propel the grenade up to 120 feet away.

name: Grenade, Fragmentation
desc: As an action, a character can throw a grenade at a point up to 60 feet away. With a grenade launcher, the character can propel the grenade up to 120 feet away. Each creature within 20 feet of an exploding fragmentation grenade must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw, taking 5d6 piercing damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

name: Grenade, Smoke
desc: As an action, a character can throw a grenade at a point up to 60 feet away. With a grenade launcher, the character can propel the grenade up to 120 feet away. One round after a smoke grenade lands, it emits a cloud of smoke that creates a heavily obscured area in a 20-foot radius. A moderate wind (at least 10 miles per hour) disperses the smoke in 4 rounds; a strong wind (20 or more miles per hour) disperses it in 1 round.

name: Gunpowder, Keg
desc: Gunpowder is chiefly used to propel a bullet out of the barrel of a pistol or rifle, or it is formed into a bomb. Gunpowder is sold in small wooden kegs and in water-resistant powder horns. Setting fire to a container full of gunpowder can cause it to explode, dealing fire damage to creatures within 10 feet of it (3d6 for a powder horn, 7d6 for a keg). A successful DC 12 Dexterity saving throw halves the damage. Setting fire to an ounce of gunpowder causes it to flare for 1 round, shedding bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet.

name: Gunpowder, Powder Horn
desc: Gunpowder is chiefly used to propel a bullet out of the barrel of a pistol or rifle, or it is formed into a bomb. Gunpowder is sold in small wooden kegs and in water-resistant powder horns. Setting fire to a container full of gunpowder can cause it to explode, dealing fire damage to creatures within 10 feet of it (3d6 for a powder horn, 7d6 for a keg). A successful DC 12 Dexterity saving throw halves the damage. Setting fire to an ounce of gunpowder causes it to flare for 1 round, shedding bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet.

desc: Proficiency with a Halberd allows you to add your proficiency bonus to the attack roll for any attack you make with it. This weapon has the following mastery property. If you hit a creature with a melee attack roll using this weapon, you can make a melee attack roll with the weapon against a second creature within 5 feet of the first that is also within your reach. You can make this extra attack only once per turn. |table-start| |row-start| |header-start|Name|header-end| |header-start|Cost|header-end| |header-start|Damage|header-end| |header-start|Weight|header-end| |header-start|Properties|header-end| |row-end| |row-start| |data-start|Halberd|data-end| |data-start|20 gp|data-end| |data-start|1d10 slashing|data-end| |data-start|6 lbs|data-end| |data-start|Heavy, Reach, Two-Handed, Cleave|data-end| |row-end| |table-end|

desc: Half plate consists of shaped metal plates that cover most of the wearer's body. name: Hammer
desc: This one-handed hammer with an iron head is useful for pounding pitons into a wall.

name: Hammer, Sledge
desc: This two-handed, iron-headed hammer is good for smashing open treasure chests.

name: Hand Mortar (Exandria)
desc: Firearms are a new and volatile technology, and as such bring their own unique set of weapon properties. Some properties are followed by a number, and this number signifies an element of that property (outlined below). These properties replace the optional ones presented in the Dungeon Master’s Guide. Firearms are ranged weapons. Reload. The weapon can be fired a number of times equal to its Reload score before you must spend 1 attack or 1 action to reload. You must have one free hand to reload a firearm. Misfire. Whenever you make an attack roll with a firearm, and the dice roll is equal to or lower than the weapon’s Misfire score, the weapon misfires. The attack misses, and the weapon cannot be used again until you spend an action to try and repair it. To repair your firearm, you must make a successful Tinker’s Tools check (DC equal to 8 + misfire score). If your check fails, the weapon is broken and must be mended out of combat at a quarter of the cost of the firearm. Creatures who use a firearm without being proficient increase the weapon’s misfire score by 1. Explosive. Upon a hit, everything within 5 ft of the target must make a Dexterity saving throw (DC equal to 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Dexterity modifier) or suffer 1d8 fire damage. If the weapon misses, the ammunition fails to detonate, or bounces away harmlessly before doing so. Ammunition: All firearms require ammunition to make an attack, and due to their rare nature, ammunition may be near impossible to find or purchase. However, if materials are gathered, you can craft ammunition yourself using your Tinker’s Tools at half the cost. Each firearm uses its own unique ammunition and is generally sold or crafted in batches listed below next to the price. **THIS IS UNOFFICIAL MATERIAL**. These game mechanics are usable in your campaign if your DM allows them but not refined by final game design and editing. They aren’t officially part of the Dungeons & Dragons game and aren’t permitted in D&D Adventurers League events unless otherwise stated. |table-start| |row-start| |header-start|Name|header-end| |header-start|Cost|header-end| |header-start|Damage|header-end| |header-start|Weight|header-end| |header-start|Properties|header-end| |row-end| |row-start| |data-start|Hand Mortar (Exandria)|data-end| |data-start|--|data-end| |data-start|2d8 fire|data-end| |data-start|10 lbs|data-end| |data-start|Reload, Misfire, Explosive|data-end| |row-end| |table-end|

desc: Hand mortar ammunition is used with a hand mortar to make a ranged attack. Each time you attack with the weapon, you expend one piece of ammunition. Drawing the ammunition from a case, or other container is part of the attack (you need a free hand to load a one-handed weapon).

name: Healer's Kit
desc: This kit is a leather pouch containing bandages, salves, and splints. The kit has ten uses. As an action, you can expend one use of the kit to stabilize a creature that has 0 hit points, without needing to make a Wisdom (^^Medicine^^) check.

name: Helm
desc: A helm - included as part of most sets of armor.

name: Hematite
desc: An opaque gray-black gemstone worth 10 gold pieces.

name: Herbalism Kit
desc: This kit contains a variety of instruments such as clippers, mortar and pestle, and pouches and vials used by herbalists to create remedies and potions. Proficiency with this kit lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make to identify or apply herbs. Also, proficiency with this kit is required to create ^^antitoxin^^ and any ^^potion of healing^^.

name: Hide
desc: This crude armor consists of thick furs and pelts. |table-start| |row-start| |header-start|Name|header-end| |header-start|Cost|header-end| |header-start|Armor Class|header-end| |header-start|Strength|header-end| |header-start|Stealth|header-end| |header-start|Weight|header-end| |row-end| |row-start| |data-start|Hide|data-end| |data-start|10 gp|data-end| |data-start|12 + Dex modifier (max 2)|data-end| |data-start|--|data-end| |data-start|--|data-end| |data-start|12 lbs|data-end| |row-end| |table-end|

name: Holy Symbol
desc: A holy symbol is a representation of a god or pantheon. A cleric or paladin can use a holy symbol as a spellcasting focus, as described in the Spellcasting section. To use the symbol in this way, the caster must hold it in hand, wear it visibly, or bear it on a shield.

name: Holy Water (flask)
desc: As an action, you can splash the contents of this flask onto a creature within 5 feet of you or throw it up to 20 feet, shattering it on impact. In either case, make a ranged attack against a target creature, treating the holy water as an improvised weapon. If the target is a fiend or undead, it takes 2d6 radiant damage. A cleric or paladin may create holy water by performing a special ritual. The ritual takes 1 hour to perform, uses 25 gp worth of powdered silver, and requires the caster to expend a 1st-level spell slot.

name: Horn
desc: If you have proficiency with a given musical instrument, you can add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make to play music with the instrument. A bard can use a musical instrument as a spellcasting focus.

name: Hourglass
desc: A standard hourglass used to measure the passage of time.

name: Hunting Trap
desc: When you use your action to set it, this trap forms a saw-toothed steel ring that snaps shut when a creature steps on a pressure plate in the center. The trap is affixed by a heavy chain to an immobile object, such as a tree or a spike driven into the ground. A creature that steps on the plate must succeed on a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw or take 1d4 piercing damage and stop moving. Thereafter, until the creature breaks free of the trap, its movement is limited by the length of the chain (typically 3 feet long). A creature can use its action to make a DC 13 Strength check, freeing itself or another creature within its reach on a success. Each failed check deals 1 piercing damage to the trapped creature.

name: Ink (1 ounce bottle)
desc: Ink is typically used with an ink pen to write.

name: Ink Pen
desc: An ink pen is a wooden stick with a special tip on the end. The tip draws ink in when dipped in a vial and leaves an ink trail when drawn across a surface.

name: Jacinth
desc: A transparent fiery orange gem worth 5,000 gold pieces

name: Jade
desc: A translucent light green, deep green, or white gemstone worth 100 gold pieces

name: Jasper
desc: An opaque blue, black, or brown gemstone worth 50 gold pieces

name: Javelin
desc: Proficiency with a Javelin allows you to add your proficiency bonus to the attack roll for any attack you make with it. This weapon has the following mastery property. To use this property, you must have a feature that lets you use it. Slow. If you hit a creature with this weapon and deal damage to it, you can reduce its Speed by 10 feet until the start of your next turn. If the creature is hit more than once by weapons that have this property, the Speed reduction doesn’t exceed 10 feet. |table-start| |row-start| |header-start|Name|header-end| |header-start|Cost|header-end| |header-start|Damage|header-end| |header-start|Weight|header-end| |header-start|Properties|header-end| |row-end| |row-start| |data-start|Javelin|data-end| |data-start|5 sp|data-end| |data-start|1d6 piercing|data-end| |data-start|2 lbs|data-end| |data-start|Thrown (range 30/120), Slow|data-end| |row-end| |table-end|

desc: An opaque deep black gemstone worth 100 gold pieces.

name: Jeweler's Tools
desc: These special tools include the items needed to pursue a craft or trade. Proficiency with a set of artisan's tools lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make using the tools in your craft. Each type of artisan's tools requires a separate proficiency.

name: Jug or Pitcher
desc: A jug or pitcher can hold 1 gallon of liquid.

name: Keelboat
desc: If you have proficiency with a certain kind of vehicle (land or water), you can add your proficiency bonus to any check you make to control that kind of vehicle in difficult circumstances. One of the smallest sailing vessels, keelboats can be sailed or rowed by a single person. These ships often transport small amounts of cargo or passengers. They're perfect for pleasure cruises, as they're easier and less expensive to operate than larger vessels. Keelboats and rowboats are used on lakes and rivers. If going downstream, add the speed of the current (typically 3 miles per hour) to the speed of the vehicle. These vehicles can’t be rowed against any significant current, but they can be pulled upstream by draft animals on the shores. **Speed** 1 mph

name: Ladder (10 foot)
desc: This item is a straight, simple wooden ladder.

name: Lamp
desc: A lamp casts bright light in a 15-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet. Once lit, it burns for 6 hours on a flask (1 pint) of oil.

name: Lance
desc: Proficiency with a Lance allows you to add your proficiency bonus to the attack roll for any attack you make with it. A Lance requires two hands to wield when you aren't mounted. This weapon has the following mastery property. To use this property, you must have a feature that lets you use it. Topple. If you hit a creature with this weapon, you can force the creature to make a Constitution saving throw (DC 8 plus the ability modifier used to make the attack roll and your Proficiency Bonus). On a failed save, the creature has the Prone condition. |table-start| |row-start| |header-start|Name|header-end| |header-start|Cost|header-end| |header-start|Damage|header-end| |header-start|Weight|header-end| |header-start|Properties|header-end| |row-end| |row-start| |data-start|Lance|data-end| |data-start|10 gp|data-end| |data-start|1d10 piercing|data-end| |data-start|6 lbs|data-end| |data-start|Reach, Topple|data-end| |row-end| |table-end|

desc: A bullseye lantern casts bright light in a 60-foot cone and dim light for an additional 60 feet. Once lit, it burns for 6 hours on a flask (1 pint) of oil.

name: Lantern, Hooded
desc: A hooded lantern casts bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet. Once lit, it burns for 6 hours on a flask (1 pint) of oil. As an action, you can lower the hood, reducing the light to dim light in a 5-foot radius.

name: Lapis Lazuli
desc: An opaque light and dark blue gemstone with yellow flecks worth 10 gold pieces.

name: Laser Pistol
desc: It’s up to you to decide whether a character has proficiency with a firearm. Characters in most D&D worlds wouldn’t have such proficiency. name: Magnifying Glass
desc: This lens allows a closer look at small objects. It is also useful as a substitute for flint and steel when starting fires. Lighting a fire with a magnifying glass requires light as bright as sunlight to focus, tinder to ignite, and about 5 minutes for the fire to ignite. A magnifying glass grants advantage on any ability check made to appraise or inspect an item that is small or highly detailed.

name: Malachite
desc: An opaque striated light and dark green gemstone worth 10 gold pieces

name: Malice (Inhaled)
desc: A creature subjected to this poison must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or become ^^poisoned^^ for 1 hour. The ^^poisoned^^ creature is ^^blinded^^. **Inhaled**. These poisons are powders or gases that take effect when inhaled. Blowing the powder or releasing the gas subjects creatures in a 5-foot cube to its effect. The resulting cloud dissipates immediately afterward. Holding one's breath is ineffective against inhaled poisons, as they affect nasal membranes, tear ducts, and other parts of the body.

name: Manacles
desc: These metal restraints can bind a Small or Medium creature. Escaping the manacles requires a successful DC 20 Dexterity check. Breaking them requires a successful DC 20 Strength check. Each set of manacles comes with one key. Without the key, a creature proficient with thieves' tools can pick the manacles' lock with a successful DC 15 Dexterity check. Manacles have 15 hit points.

name: Mason's Tools
desc: These special tools include the items needed to pursue a craft or trade. Proficiency with a set of artisan's tools lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make using the tools in your craft. Each type of artisan's tools requires a separate proficiency.

name: Mastiff
desc: **Mastiff Statistics** A good mount can help you move more quickly through the wilderness, but its primary purpose is to carry the gear that would otherwise slow you down. An animal pulling a carriage, cart, chariot, sled, or wagon can move weight up to five times its base carrying capacity, including the weight of the vehicle. If multiple animals pull the same vehicle, they can add their carrying capacity together. **Speed:** 40 ft. **Carrying Capacity:** 195 lbs.

desc: Proficiency with a Maul allows you to add your proficiency bonus to the attack roll for any attack you make with it. This weapon has the following mastery property. If you hit a creature with this weapon, you can force the creature to make a Constitution saving throw (DC 8 plus the ability modifier used to make the attack roll and your Proficiency Bonus). name: Mess Kit
desc: This tin box contains a cup and simple cutlery. The box clamps together, and one side can be used as a cooking pan and the other as a plate or shallow bowl.

name: Midnight Tears (Ingested)
desc: A creature that ingests this poison suffers no effect until the stroke of midnight. If the poison has not been neutralized before then, the creature must succeed on a DC 17 Constitution saving throw, taking 31 (9d6) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. **Ingested**. A creature must swallow an entire dose of ingested poison to suffer its effects. The dose can be delivered in food or a liquid. You may decide that a partial dose has a reduced effect, such as allowing advantage on the saving throw or dealing only half damage on a failed save.

name: Mirror, Steel
desc: A steel mirror is handy when you want to look around corners, signal friends with reflected sunlight, keep an eye on a medusa, make sure that you look good enough to present yourself to the queen, or examine wounds that you’ve received on hard-to-see parts of your body.

name: Monster Hunter's Pack
desc: Includes a chest, a crowbar, a hammer, three wooden stakes, a holy symbol, a flask of holy water, a set of manacles, a steel mirror, a flask of oil, a tinderbox, and 3 torches.

name: Moonstone
desc: A translucent white gemstone with a pale blue glow worth 50 gold pieces.

name: Musket (Exandria)
desc: Firearms are a new and volatile technology, and as such bring their own unique set of weapon properties. Some properties are followed by a number, and this number signifies an element of that property (outlined below). These properties replace the optional ones presented in the Dungeon Master’s Guide. Firearms are ranged weapons. Reload. The weapon can be fired a number of times equal to its Reload score before you must spend 1 attack or 1 action to reload. You must have one free hand to reload a firearm. Misfire. Whenever you make an attack roll with a firearm, and the dice roll is equal to or lower than the weapon’s Misfire score, the weapon misfires. The attack misses, and the weapon cannot be used again until you spend an action to try and repair it. To repair your firearm, you must make a successful Tinker’s Tools check (DC equal to 8 + misfire score). If your check fails, the weapon is broken and must be mended out of combat at a quarter of the cost of the firearm. Creatures who use a firearm without being proficient increase the weapon’s misfire score by 1. Explosive. Upon a hit, everything within 5 ft of the target must make a Dexterity saving throw (DC equal to 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Dexterity modifier) or suffer 1d8 fire damage. If the weapon misses, the ammunition fails to detonate, or bounces away harmlessly before doing so. Ammunition. All firearms require ammunition to make an attack, and due to their rare nature, ammunition may be near impossible to find or purchase. However, if materials are gathered, you can craft ammunition yourself using your Tinker’s Tools at half the cost. Each firearm uses its own unique ammunition and is generally sold or crafted in batches listed below next to the price. **THIS IS UNOFFICIAL MATERIAL** These game mechanics are usable in your campaign if your DM allows them but not refined by final game design and editing. They aren’t officially part of the Dungeons & Dragons game and aren’t permitted in D&D Adventurers League events unless otherwise stated. |table-start| |row-start| |header-start|Name|header-end| |header-start|Cost|header-end| |header-start|Damage|header-end| |header-start|Weight|header-end| |header-start|Properties|header-end| |row-end| |row-start| |data-start|Musket (Exandria)|data-end| |data-start|300 gp|data-end| |data-start|1d12 piercing|data-end| |data-start|10 lbs|data-end| |data-start|Two-Handed, Reload, Misfire|data-end| |row-end| |table-end|

name: Musket (Exandria) Bullets
desc: Firearm bullets are used with a weapon that has the reload property to make a ranged attack. Each time you attack with the weapon, you expend one piece of ammunition. Drawing the ammunition from a case, or other container is part of the attack (you need a free hand to load a one-handed weapon).

name: Navigator's Tools
desc: This set of instruments is used for navigation at sea. Proficiency with navigator's tools lets you chart a ship's course and follow navigation charts. In addition, these tools allow you to add your proficiency bonus to any ability check you make to avoid getting lost at sea.

name: Net
desc: Proficiency with a net allows you to add your proficiency bonus to the attack roll for any attack you make with it. A Large or smaller creature hit by a net is restrained until it is freed. A net has no effect on creatures that are formless, or creatures that are Huge or larger. A creature can use its action to make a DC 10 Strength check, freeing itself or another creature within its reach on a success. Dealing 5 slashing damage to the net (AC 10) also frees the creature without harming it, ending the effect and destroying the net. When you use an action, bonus action, or reaction to attack with a net, you can make only one attack regardless of the number of attacks you can normally make. |table-start| |row-start| |header-start|Name|header-end| |header-start|Cost|header-end| |header-start|Damage|header-end| |header-start|Weight|header-end| |header-start|Properties|header-end| |row-end| |row-start| |data-start|Net|data-end| |data-start|1 gp|data-end| |data-start|0 bludgeoning|data-end| |data-start|3 lbs|data-end| |data-start|Special, Thrown (range 5/15)|data-end| |row-end| |table-end|

name: Obsidian
desc: An opaque black gemstone worth 10 gold pieces

name: Oil (flask)
desc: Oil usually comes in a clay flask that holds 1 pint. As an action, you can splash the oil in this flask onto a creature within 5 feet of you or throw it up to 20 feet, shattering it on impact. Make a ranged attack against a target creature or object, treating the oil as an improvised weapon. On a hit, the target is covered in oil. If the target takes any fire damage before the oil dries (after 1 minute), the target takes an additional 5 fire damage from the burning oil. You can also pour a flask of oil on the ground to cover a 5-foot-square area, provided that the surface is level. If lit, the oil burns for 2 rounds and deals 5 fire damage to any creature that enters the area or ends its turn in the area. A creature can take this damage only once per turn.

name: Oil of Taggit (Contact)
desc: A creature subjected to this poison must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or become ^^poisoned^^ for 24 hours. The ^^poisoned^^ creature is ^^unconscious^^. The creature wakes up if it takes damage. Contact. Contact poison can be smeared on an object and remains potent until it is touched or washed off. A creature that touches contact poison with exposed skin suffers its effects.

name: Onyx
desc: An opaque gemstone with bands of black and white, or pure black or white worth 50 gold pieces

name: Opal
desc: A translucent pale blue with green and golden mottling gemstone worth 1,000 gold pieces

name: Orb
desc: An arcane focus is a special item designed to channel the power of arcane spells. A sorcerer, warlock, or wizard can use such an item as a spellcasting focus, as described in the ^^Spellcasting^^ section.

name: Padded
desc: Padded armor consists of quilted layers of cloth and batting. |table-start| |row-start| |header-start|Name|header-end| |header-start|Cost|header-end| |header-start|Armor Class|header-end| |header-start|Strength|header-end| |header-start|Stealth|header-end| |header-start|Weight|header-end| |row-end| |row-start| |data-start|Padded|data-end| |data-start|5 gp|data-end| |data-start|11 + Dex modifier|data-end| |data-start|--|data-end| |data-start|Disadvantage|data-end| |data-start|8 lbs|data-end| |row-end| |table-end|

name: Pale Tincture (Ingested)
desc: A creature subjected to this poison must succeed on a DC 16 Constitution saving throw or take 3 (1d6) poison damage and become ^^poisoned^^. name: Piton
desc: When a wall doesn’t offer handholds and footholds, you can make your own. A piton is a steel spike with an eye through which you can loop a rope.

name: Plate
desc: Plate consists of shaped, interlocking metal plates to cover the entire body. name: Playing Card Set
desc: If you are proficient with a gaming set, you can add your proficiency bonus to ability checks you make to play a game with that set.

name: Poison, Basic (vial)
desc: You can use the poison in this vial to coat one slashing or piercing weapon or up to three pieces of ammunition. Applying the poison takes an action. A creature hit by the poisoned weapon or ammunition must succeed on a DC 10 Constitution saving throw or take 1d4 poison damage. Once applied, the poison retains potency for 1 minute before drying.

name: Poisoner's Kit
desc: A poisoner's kit includes the vials, chemicals, and other equipment necessary for the creation of poisons. Proficiency with this kit lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make to craft or use poisons.

name: Pole (10-foot)
desc: When you suspect a trap, you can put the end of your 10-foot pole through that hole in the wall instead of reaching in with your hand.

name: Pot, Iron
desc: An iron pot can hold 1 gallon of liquid.

name: Potion of Healing
desc: A character who drinks the magical red fluid in this vial regains 2d4 + 2 hit points. Drinking or administering a potion takes an action.

name: Potter's Tools
desc: These special tools include the items needed to pursue a craft or trade. Proficiency with a set of artisan's tools lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make using the tools in your craft. Each type of artisan's tools requires a separate proficiency.

name: Pouch
desc: A cloth or leather pouch can hold 1/5 cubic foot/ 6 pounds of gear - or up to 20 sling bullets or 50 blowgun needles, among other things. A compartmentalized pouch for holding spell components is called a component pouch.

name: Priest's Pack
desc: Includes a backpack, a blanket, 10 candles, a tinderbox, an alms box, 2 blocks of incense, a censer, vestments, 2 days of rations, and a waterskin.

name: Purple Worm Poison (Injury)
desc: This poison must be harvested from a dead or ^^incapacitated^^ ^^purple worm^^. A creature subjected to this poison must make a DC 19 Constitution saving throw, taking 42 (12d6) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. | Injury | Injury poison can be applied to weapons, ammunition, trap components, and other objects that deal piercing or slashing damage and remains potent until delivered through a wound or washed off. A creature that takes piercing or slashing damage from an object coated with the poison is exposed to its effects.

name: Quarterstaff
desc: Proficiency with a Quarterstaff allows you to add your proficiency bonus to the attack roll for any attack you make with it. This weapon has the following mastery property. To use this property, you must have a feature that lets you use it. ^^Topple^^. If you hit a creature with this weapon, you can force the creature to make a Constitution saving throw (DC 8 plus the ability modifier used to make the attack roll and your Proficiency Bonus). On a failed save, the creature has the Prone condition.

name: Quartz
desc: A transparent white, smoky gray, or yellow gemstone worth 50 gold pieces

name: Quiver
desc: A quiver can hold up to 20 arrows.

name: Ram, Portable
desc: You can use a portable ram to break down doors. When doing so, you gain a +4 bonus on the Strength check. One other character can help you use the ram, giving you advantage on this check.

name: Rapier
desc: Proficiency with a Rapier allows you to add your proficiency bonus to the attack roll for any attack you make with it. This weapon has the following mastery property. To use this property, you must have a feature that lets you use it. Vex. If you hit a creature with this weapon and deal damage to the creature, you have Advantage on your next attack roll against that creature before the end of your next turn. Name Cost Damage Weight Properties Rapier 25 gp 1d8 piercing 2 lbs Finesse, Vex

name: Rations (1 day)
desc: Rations consist of dry foods suitable for extended travel, including jerky, dried fruit, hardtack, and nuts.

name: Reliquary
desc: A holy symbol is a representation of a god or pantheon. A cleric or paladin can use a holy symbol as a spellcasting focus, as described in the ^^Spellcasting^^ section. To use the symbol in this way, the caster must hold it in hand, wear it visibly, or bear it on a shield.

name: Revolver
desc: It’s up to you to decide whether a character has proficiency with a firearm. Characters in most D&D worlds wouldn’t have such proficiency. During their downtime, characters can use the training rules in the Player’s Handbook to acquire proficiency, assuming that they have enough ammunition to keep the weapons working while mastering their use. Name Cost Damage Weight Properties Revolver -- 2d8 piercing 3 lbs Ammunition (Firearms), (Range 40/120), Reload (6 shots)

name: Rhodochrosite
desc: An opaque light pink gemstone worth 10 gold pieces

name: Riding Horse
desc: Riding Horse Statistics A good mount can help you move more quickly through the wilderness, but its primary purpose is to carry the gear that would otherwise slow you down. An animal pulling a carriage, cart, chariot, sled, or wagon can move weight up to five times its base carrying capacity, including the weight of the vehicle. If multiple animals pull the same vehicle, they can add their carrying capacity together. Notes: Speed 60 ft., Carrying Capacity 480 lbs.

name: Rifle, Automatic
desc: It’s up to you to decide whether a character has proficiency with a firearm. Characters in most D&D worlds wouldn’t have such proficiency. desc: It’s up to you to decide whether a character has proficiency with a firearm. Characters in most D&D worlds wouldn’t have such proficiency. name: Ring Mail
desc: This armor is leather armor with heavy rings sewn into it. The rings help reinforce the armor against blows from swords and axes. Ring mail is inferior to chain mail, and it's usually worn only by those who can't afford better armor. Name Cost Armor Class Strength Stealth Weight Ring Mail 30 gp 14 -- Disadvantage

name: Robes

name: Rope, Hempen (50 feet)
desc: Rope, has 2 hit points and can be burst with a DC 17 Strength check.

name: Rope, Silk (50 feet)
desc: Rope, has 2 hit points and can be burst with a DC 17 Strength check.

name: Rowboat
desc: If you have proficiency with a certain kind of vehicle (land or water), you can add your proficiency bonus to any check you make to control that kind of vehicle in difficult circumstances. Rowboats are used on lakes and rivers. If going downstream, add the speed of the current (typically 3 miles per hour) to the speed of the vehicle. These vehicles can’t be rowed against any significant current, but they can be pulled upstream by draft animals on the shores. A rowboat weighs 100 pounds, in case adventurers carry it over land. Notes: Speed 1 1/2 mph

name: Ruby
desc: A transparent clear red to deep crimson gemstone worth 5,000 gold pieces

name: Sack
desc: A sack can hold 1 cubic foot/ 30 pounds of gear.

name: Saddle, Exotic
desc: An exotic saddle is required for riding any aquatic or flying mount.

name: Saddle, Military
desc: A military saddle braces the rider, helping you keep your seat on an active mount in battle. It gives you advantage on any check you make to remain mounted.

name: Saddle, Pack
desc: A standard saddle for a pack mount.

name: Saddle, Riding
desc: A standard saddle for a riding mount.

name: Saddlebags
desc: Standard saddlebags that can be attached to a mount's saddle.

desc: If you have proficiency with a certain kind of vehicle (land or water), you can add your proficiency bonus to any check you make to control that kind of vehicle in difficult circumstances. **Speed** 2 mph

name: Sardonyx

name: Scale Mail
desc: This armor consists of a coat and leggings (and perhaps a separate skirt) of leather covered with overlapping pieces of metal, much like the scales of a fish. The suit includes gauntlets.

name: Scale, Merchant's
desc: A scale includes a small balance, pans, and a suitable assortment of weights up to 2 pounds. With it, you can measure the exact weight of small objects, such as raw precious metals or trade goods, to help determine their worth.

name: Scholar's Pack
desc: Includes a backpack, a book of lore, a bottle of ink, an ink pen, 10 sheets of parchment, a little bag of sand, and a small knife.

name: Scimitar
desc: Proficiency with a Scimitar allows you to add your proficiency bonus to the attack roll for any attack you make with it. This weapon has the following mastery property. When you make the extra attack of the Light property, you can make it as part of the Attack action instead of as a Bonus Action. You can make this extra attack only once per turn.

name: Sealing Wax
desc: When you press a signet ring into warm sealing wax, you leave an identifying mark.

name: Signal Whistle

name: Signet Ring
desc: Each signet ring has a distinctive design carved into it. When you press this ring into warm sealing wax, you leave an identifying mark.

name: Sled
desc: If you have proficiency with a certain kind of vehicle (land or water), you can add your proficiency bonus to any check you make to control that kind of vehicle in difficult circumstances.

name: Sling
desc: Proficiency with a Sling allows you to add your proficiency bonus to the attack roll for any attack you make with it. This weapon has the following mastery property. To use this property, you must have a feature that lets you use it. Slow. If you hit a creature with this weapon and deal damage to it, you can reduce its Speed by 10 feet until the start of your next turn. If the creature is hit more than once by weapons that have this property, the Speed reduction doesn’t exceed 10 feet.

name: Sling Bullets
desc: Sling bullets are used with a weapon that has the ammunition property to make a ranged attack. Each time you attack with the weapon, you expend one piece of ammunition. Drawing the ammunition from a quiver, case, or other container is part of the attack (you need a free hand to load a one-handed weapon). At the end of the battle, you can recover half your expended ammunition by taking a minute to search the battlefield.

name: Small Knife
desc: A small knife, typically found in a scholar's pack.

name: Smith's Tools
desc: These special tools include the items needed to pursue a craft or trade. Proficiency with a set of artisan's tools lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make using the tools in your craft. Each type of artisan's tools requires a separate proficiency.

name: Soap
desc: A commodity used for bathing.

name: Spear
desc: Proficiency with a Spear allows you to add your proficiency bonus to the attack roll for any attack you make with it. This weapon has the following mastery property. If you hit a creature with this weapon, that creature has Disadvantage on its next attack roll before the start of your next turn.

name: Spellbook
desc: Essential for wizards, a spellbook is a leather-bound tome with 100 blank vellum pages suitable for recording spells.

name: Spiked Armor
desc: Spiked armor is a rare type of medium armor made by dwarves. It consists of a leather coat and leggings covered with spikes that are usually made of metal.

name: Spikes, Iron (10)
desc: Standard iron spikes typically used with a hammer.

name: Spinel
desc: A transparent gemstone of red, red-brown, or deep green worth 100 gold pieces

name: Splint
desc: This armor is made of narrow vertical strips of metal riveted to a backing of leather that is worn over cloth padding. Flexible chain mail protects the joints.

name: Sprig of Mistletoe
desc: A druid can use a Sprig of Mistletoe (or holly) as a spellcasting focus, as described in the Spellcasting section.

name: Spyglass
desc: Objects viewed through a spyglass are magnified to twice their size.

name: Staff
desc: An arcane focus is a special item designed to channel the power of arcane spells. A sorcerer, warlock, or wizard can use such an item as a spellcasting focus, as described in the Spellcasting section.

name: Stake (Wooden)
desc: Stakes made out of wood, typically found in a monster hunter's pack.

name: Star Rose Quartz
desc: A translucent rosy Gemstone with a white star-shaped center worth 50 gold pieces.

name: Star Ruby
desc: A translucent ruby gemstone with a white star-shaped center worth 1,000 gold pieces.

name: Star Sapphire
desc: A translucent blue sapphire gemstone with a white star-shaped center worth 1,000 gold pieces.

name: String
desc: A 10-foot length of string, typically found in a burglar's pack.

name: Studded Leather
desc: Made from tough but flexible leather, studded leather is reinforced with close-set rivets or spikes.

name: Tantan
desc: A simple and portable canvas shelter, a tent sleeps two.

name: Thieves' Tools
desc: This set of tools includes a small file, a set of lock picks, a small mirror mounted on a metal handle, a set of narrow-bladed scissors, and a pair of pliers. Proficiency with these tools lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make to disarm traps or open locks.

name: Three-Dragon Ante Set
desc: If you are proficient with a gaming set, you can add your proficiency bonus to ability checks you make to play a game with that set.

name: Tiger Eye
desc: A translucent brown gemstone with a golden center worth 10 gold pieces

name: Tinderbox
desc: This small container holds flint, fire steel, and tinder (usually dry cloth soaked in light oil) used to kindle a fire. Using it to light a torch -- or anything else with abundant, exposed fuel -- takes an action. Lighting any other fire takes 1 minute.

name: Tinker's Tools
desc: These special tools include the items needed to pursue a craft or trade. Proficiency with a set of artisan's tools lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make using the tools in your craft. Each type of artisan's tools requires a separate proficiency.

name: Topaz
desc: A transparent golden yellow gemstone worth 500 gold pieces

name: Torch
desc: A torch burns for 1 hour, providing bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet. If you make a melee attack with a burning torch and hit, it deals 1 fire damage.

name: Torpor (Ingested)
desc:
A creature subjected to this poison must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or become poisoned for 4d6 hours. The poisoned creature is incapacitated.

Ingested. A creature must swallow an entire dose of ingested poison to suffer its effects. The dose can be delivered in food or a liquid. You may decide that a partial dose has a reduced effect, such as allowing advantage on the saving throw or dealing only half damage on a failed save.

name: Totem
desc: A druid can use a Totem as a spellcasting focus, as described in the Spellcasting section.

name: Tourmaline
